comments: The numbers in A007498 sorted according to the magnitude of the corresponding prime. - _T. D. Noe_, Sep 08 2005
links: Ray Chandler, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..99
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Unique Prime
Index entries for sequences related to decimal expansion of 1/n
example: The decimal expansion of 1/101 is 0.00990099..., having a period of 4 and it is the only prime with that period.
mathematica: nmax = 10000; primesPeriods = Reap[Do[p = Cyclotomic[n, 10]/GCD[n, Cyclotomic[n, 10]]; If[PrimeQ[p], Print[n]; Sow[{p, n}]], {n, 1, nmax}]][[2, 1]]; Sort[primesPeriods][[All, 2]] // Prepend[#, 1]& // Take[#, 58]& (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Mar 29 2013 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
extensions: More terms from _T. D. Noe_, Sep 08 2005
